item.title: [PDFBOX-5380] Could not read embedded TTF for font
item.description:
Getting below warning  while  converting pdf to image using PDFBOX lib

Our PDF is embedded with font GillSansStd-BoldItalic and others font and pdfbox not able to read them and Using fallback font 'TimesNewRomanPS-BoldItalicMT' for 'GillSansStd-BoldItalic' 

Converted Image is not proper.

How to resolve it.

item.summary: Could not read embedded TTF for font

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Don't use an OpenType CFF (postscript) font as TrueType font because it's not.

A bit more on this:

Your font isn't a "TrueType" font as claimed in the /SubType, it's an OpenType font with CFF table. It doesn't have the "loca" and "glyf" tables, instead it has a "CFF " table. I suspect (but I'm not really sure) the subtype should have been /OpenType, and the font stream in /FontFile3 instead of /FontFile2.

Look into the PDF 32000 Spezifikation, "Table 126 – Embedded font organization for various font types".
You should also update to 2.0.25. On my computer the € is displayed properly.

The last commit improves the exception message, because just a week ago another person contacted me about this. But the problem doesn't go away. It's important that when the PDF-creating software excepts a TrueType font, then feed it only with .ttf files. Send the URL of this ticket to the creator of the document.

Hello tilman 

Thank you for your quick response.

If we will change to cff type  instead of TrueType in pdf  then will pdfbox  support cff type ?

Will it work fine ?

Your file wasn't created by PDFBox, but by "HP Exstream Version 9.5.301 32-bit".

I looked at the specification again, /OpenType must be elsewhere. Your subtype is likely CIDFontType0. And there is more to be changed. A correct file can be found at PDFBOX-2177.
